Because our enemy is far away and we have ample open space, moving UP seems a good plan. By going UP to (8,9) we not only stay safe but put ourselves in an excellent position to continue aiming toward the apple at (0,9) (or later reposition as needed).

Thus, after weighing our options and thinking ahead, I decide that the best move is to go UP.

Our snake’s current head (from our evaluated details) is at (8,8) with body segments trailing behind at (8,7) and (8,6). From here we can only move UP (to (8,9)), LEFT (to (7,8)), or RIGHT (to (9,8)) because going down would reverse into our neck.

Evaluating our options:
• Moving UP to (8,9) puts us into the top row, which is safe and positions us closer to the apple at (0,9). Once there, we could later maneuver left to collect it.  
• Moving LEFT to (7,8) is safe but leaves us less advanced vertically. We’d still have to work upward to get to our target.  
• Moving RIGHT to (9,8) is also safe, but it puts us next to the edge, which reduces future maneuverability.

Given that our enemy is far away and we have abundant open space, moving UP not only keeps us safe but also places us in an advantageous position to reach the apple at (0,9). 

Therefore, my decided next move is: UP.
